unnormalised: **Telecom Sector Sees Accelerated Fiber-to-Home Expansion in India**
normalised: **telecom sector sees accelerated fiber to home expansion in india**

unnormalised: New Delhi, 20/07/2024 - India's telecommunications landscape is undergoing a rapid transformation, driven by accelerated Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) deployment across the nation. Bharat Fiber Nigam Limited (BFNL) announced today that it has laid over 50,000 km of optical fiber in the past quarter, primarily focusing on connecting rural areas like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. This initiative aims to bridge the digital divide and provide high-speed internet access to underserved communities.
normalised: new delhi, twentieth july two thousand and twenty four - india's telecommunications landscape is undergoing a rapid transformation, driven by accelerated fiber to home (F T T H) deployment across the nation. bharat fiber nigam limited (B F N L) announced today that it has laid over fifty thousand kilometer of optical fiber in the past quarter, primarily focusing on connecting rural areas like uttar pradesh and bihar. this initiative aims to bridge the digital divide and provide high speed internet access to underserved communities.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are also aggressively expanding their FTTH networks. JioFiber reported adding over 2 million new subscribers since 01/04/2024, fueled by competitive pricing and bundled content offerings. Airtel Xstream Fiber is focusing on premium offerings, targeting urban consumers with speeds exceeding 300 Mbps. Industry analysts predict that FTTH subscriptions will surpass 50 million by the end of 2025. This surge is expected to boost India's digital economy, fostering innovation and creating new opportunities for businesses and individuals alike. The TRAI is scheduled to release its updated regulations regarding FTTH infrastructure sharing by 17:00 hrs on 27/07/2024. The government's ambitious 'Digital India' program continues to be the primary catalyst for this growth.
normalised: reliance jio and bharti airtel are also aggressively expanding their F T T H networks. jiofiber reported adding over two million new subscribers since first april two thousand and twenty four, fueled by competitive pricing and bundled content offerings. airtel xstream fiber is focusing on premium offerings, targeting urban consumers with speeds exceeding three hundred M B P S. industry analysts predict that F T T H subscriptions will surpass fifty million by the end of two thousand and twenty five. this surge is expected to boost india's digital economy, fostering innovation and creating new opportunities for businesses and individuals alike. the T R A I is scheduled to release its updated regulations regarding F T T H infrastructure sharing by seventeen zero zero hours on twenty seventh july two thousand and twenty four. the government's ambitious 'digital india' program continues to be the primary catalyst for this growth.
